byline.contributor: Daniel E. Slotnik contributed reporting. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

abstract: Phil Chess, co-founder of storied Chicago record label Chess Records, dies at age 95; label was renowned for representing expatriated Southern black musicians and for its creation of musical sub-genre Chicago blues.

headline.print_headline: Phil Chess, Whose Label Elevated  Unknown Blues Singers, Dies at 95
headline.main: Phil Chess, Whose Record Label Elevated Unknown Blues Musicians, Dies at 95

snippet: Chess Records, the label founded by Mr. Chess and his brother, became successful by finding little-known performers and persuading radio stations to play their music....
lead_paragraph: Chess Records, the label founded by Mr. Chess and his brother, became successful by finding little-known performers and persuading radio stations to play their music.
